This game is the purest, no frills competitive shooter that's ever been created. It requires you to put in the work to learn the mechanics, and rewards you grandly for it. Nothing feels better than being in a counterstrike flow state. 

The only downsides this game has are the community, not the game itself. Unfortunately the game is full of racists, toxic players, griefers. But not as many cheaters as the internet would make you think.
well the game is not bad
pew pew is fun but so many hackers :(

Counter-Strike: Global Offensive expands upon the team-based action gameplay that it pioneered when it was launched 19 years ago. CS: GO features new maps, characters, weapons, and game modes, and delivers updated versions of the classic CS content.

Personally, I've enjoyed this game so far with occasional rage moments purely because sometimes this game doesn't make sense. For example, I've shot an enemy with an AK-47 in the neck and did 32 damage or so. That doesn't happen often but when it does, God it pisses me off just like those 12 year-old spoiled Russian kids who scream in their shitty language all game and do literally everything apart from trying to win. But all in all, I'd say I'm pretty experienced with this game since I've played 102 hours + some of CS 1.6 and so far, I'm enjoying my time, especially playing with friends.
